text:
Glenn Frey of Eagles dies at 67

Glenn Frey, who co-founded the Eagles and with Don Henley became one of history’s most successful song-writing teams with such hits as Hotel California and Life in the Fast Lane , passed away on Monday.

Frey was 67 and had been battling multiple ailments. The band’s website said he passed away in New York.

Guitarist Frey and drummer Henley formed the Eagles in Los Angeles in the early 1970s, along with guitarist Bernie Leadon and bassist Randy Meisner. They became a top act over the next decade, embodying the melodic California sound. Frey’s solo hits include The Heat Is On and Smuggler’s Blues . — AP
title: Eagles co-founder Glenn Frey dies at 67
